bug.short_desc: Minimize and reopen a maximized window

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
I have a window of qx.ui.window.Window.
If I maximize the window and click on the minimize button, the window hides. That's OK.
But now if I try to reopen the window using the open() method, the window seems to be still maximized but has the old position as it was before I maximize the window.
If I try to move that window it want to keep the right and bottom side at the border of the browser.
This means, if I move the window to the right side, the window width decreases and uses the available space between left window side and right browser side. And the same for the height.
Seems to be a bug in qooxdoo...

I have created an example in Playground:
http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/playground/#%7B%22code%22%3A%22var%2520win%2520%253D%2520new%2520qx.ui.window.Window(%2522Window%2522)%253B%250Awin.setWidth(300)%253B%250Awin.setHeight(200)%253B%250A%250Avar%2520button%2520%253D%2520new%2520qx.ui.form.Button(%2522Show%2520Window%2522)%253B%250Abutton.addListener(%2522execute%2522%252C%2520function()%250A%257B%250A%2520%2520win.open()%253B%250A%257D)%253B%250A%250Athis.getRoot().add(win%252C%2520%257Bleft%253A20%252C%2520top%253A20%257D)%253B%250Awin.open()%253B%250A%250Athis.getRoot().add(button)%253B%22%2C%20%22mode%22%3A%22ria%22%7D
Just maximize the window and minimize it. Then click on the "Show Window" button and try to move the window.
